attributes.action: Campaign for a Festival of Britain 2021 to celebrate 70 years since last one
attributes.background: UK has faced years of austerity - likely to continue up to 2021. This would give the British people a feel-good factor and added  prestige throughout the world, which will promote tourism.  An opportunity for trade and industry visits from other nations to showcase the UK as open for business
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the previous Festival of Britain in 1951 and look at what events occurred from those days and consider an updated version which included London and other provincial cities.   Put into place exhibitions, the provision of a festival ship (which occurred previously to promote British ports and industry).  Ask other major cities to put on events that may be a speciality to that particular region (eg historical interests and future innovations).

attributes.action: Prevent the DVLA from selling personal information to outside companies
attributes.background: It has come to light that the DVLA are selling personal information to parking companies for the purpose of pursuing individuals in respect of alleged parking offences

attributes.action: Petition for annual increase for pensioners outside the EU Block.
attributes.background: My pension has been deferred for 5 years, by various Governments and now I find, I will not get yearly pension rises, because I am not in an EU country!

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to leave dogs chained up outside for hours on end.
attributes.background: Imagine being chained up, especially in extreme weather conditions such as hot sun, rain and freezing temperatures. It's not the way you would treat a human being, so why do people treat dogs like this? They need the basic needs like food, warmth, shelter and love.
attributes.additional_details: I have grown up with dogs all my life, most of them rescued from homes that don't care for them properly or they're surplus to requirement. In Pennsylvania, USA, they have just passed "Libre's Law", which prosecutes owners for leaving their dogs chained outside under certain conditions. For more information: http://www.philly.com/philly/news/animal-cruelty-pennsylvania-libres-law-20170628.html?mobi=true

attributes.action: To require each energy supplier to set a standard Standing Charge across tariffs
attributes.background: Energy suppliers offer multiple tariffs, which are likely to have different combinations of unit price and daily standing charge. Making an informed decision about WHICH tariff and/or supplier to use is made more complex by having these differences. Unit only variables would simplify that choice.
attributes.additional_details: I've just been through the process again, spent hours doing many calculations and making comparisons between, not only one energy supplier's tariffs, but also between multiple suppliers, it was confusing and impossible to make an informed choice. I consulted acquaintances, friends and family, who all agreed. Having just ONE standard daily standing charge would make such choice simpler by removing one variable. Switching may be ideal in principle, but is often a leap in the dark for many people.

attributes.action: Make feminine hygiene products free for women.
attributes.background: How much money do we need to spend on something we can't help but need? Condoms are free from clinics, why shouldn't sanitary towels and tampons be? It's a disgrace and it needs addressing! We can't keep ignoring it. It's real and it's wrong.
attributes.additional_details: We shouldn't be paying for something our bodies need. It's a disgrace. I'm sure no woman on the planet likes the menstrual cycle. It should be free. We need to address this and actually do something about it. Stop ignoring it and accepting it - it's WRONG. It would be free if it were men that needed them. We need to fight this!

attributes.action: Improve safety and quality of our road network and reduce congestion
attributes.background: 1.Starting in driving schools by ensuring there is more attention on teaching safe driving on motorways and dual carriage ways. We think that driving on these types of roads requires techniques that are not well emphasised by current training methods.
attributes.additional_details:
Improvement could be achieved if new drivers would be taught of correct speed selection, acceleration and keeping left when not overtaking. 
2.Improving existing roads by installing more signs to remind drivers of simple rules such as:
-Keep left when not overtaking (middle lane hogging)
-Keep your distance

attributes.action: Change the way fines i.e. Speeding/Drunk and Disorderly are calculated.
attributes.background: Instead of a fixed price fine we should have a proportional fine so it affects each person the same way, it should be 10% of the offending persons average weekly wage (10% of 1/52th, 1 weeks worth, of last year's net pay) or a minimum of Â£80, whichever is the greater.
attributes.additional_details:
This way it have much more of an equal affect upon the culprit and even out some balance of a unfair prosecution system which effects the poorest more.

For example in October this year (2017) a professional footballer was caught speeding and was fined Â£440, alot of money for a person on minimum wage but does not have the same impact on someone reportedly earning Â£37,500 per week. This may be an extreme example however I feel this change allow punishment to be felt equally across the board.

attributes.action: Pass legislation for the use of indelible ink pens mandatory for ALL elections.
attributes.background: In an age where pens are as cost effective as pencils, there is no excuse why the use of indelible ink pens should not be made mandatory. Old arguments on cost and potential for ink to smudge are not relevant today. However, a perception votes cast using a pencil can be manipulated, is a concern.

attributes.action: Eliminate Tax Avoidance - Introduce 2% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: As an example, eBayâs total UK revenue last year was cÂ£1bn and Â£1.6m in corporation tax was paid. This petition would see eBay pay a minimum Â£20m (12.5 times more).  All companies regardless of size would be forced to pay their fair share of tax including Apple, Amazon, Google and Starbucks.
attributes.additional_details:
It is reasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated equally and the minimum corporation tax rate on turnover should be the price they pay.

The minimum corporation tax could be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.

Incidentally, FTSE 100 companies, on average, have seen their corporation tax expense to turnover go from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years.

attributes.action: Increase the funding for additional support for prison officers well-being.
attributes.background:
Prison officers are in a highly demanding and challenging job that requires readily available support systems in terms of both their mental health and well-being. 
We are petitioning for:
More counselling with independent professional counsellors to deal with mental health in the work place.
attributes.additional_details:
7159 assaults on prison officers and serious assaults on prison officers has trebled from previous year (MOJ, 2017); impacting their psychological and physical safety at work, overall effecting the prison system in whole.
We think this intervention would be beneficial for prison officers, prisoners and society as a whole.

attributes.action: Move pedestrian crossing buttons further away from roadside for safety.
attributes.background: I believe that the position of 'Crossing Buttons' is too near the road. Children often run towards the button, wanting to be the one that presses it. A trip or stumble could easily result in them falling into the road or cause a motorist to swerve/brake etc. Bringing risk of accident or fatality.

attributes.action: The government must carry out a public inquiry into offshore tax havens.
attributes.background:
The UK wealth gap is widening and child poverty is increasing.  Yet the UK has seen a boom in the number of high-net-worth individuals.

To show commitment for creating a fairer society, the government must start by investigating the use of offshore tax havens.
attributes.additional_details: CEO pay is 129 times that of the average worker.  In 2000 CEOs earned 47 times that of the average worker.  In the 1970s the ratio was much lower.  Meanwhile, UK food bank use continues to rise, schools are underfunded and understaffed, hospitals cannot cope with the number of patients they are receiving and transport services are overpriced.

attributes.action: Ban nut products by supermarket checkouts promoted for impulsive purchasing.
attributes.background: For those with severe nut allergies such as myself, avoiding the nut aisle in a supermarket is usually easy, however having to dodge them at the checkout where supermarkets promote impulsive buying, makes shopping in general increasingly difficult and potentially dangerous.
attributes.additional_details: I've noticed more and more that supermarkets are stocking shelves at the checkout with nut products to encourage shoppers to purchase them impulsively. Although impulse buying is not something that concerns me, having to weave through the already narrow area to pay for your shopping to avoid having an allergy attack seems totally unnecessary, which is why I think that nut products should only be sold on an aisle in the shop, and not used as a product to promote impulsive buying at the checkout.

attributes.action: Make all nightclubs and pubs charge the same price entry for men and women
attributes.background: With all the recent outrage about gender equality and the unfair treatment of women, I would like to highlight an issue which I feel should have been changed by now considering it is illegal to discriminate against someone because of gender: Nightclubs in the UK charge men more for entry.
attributes.additional_details: This is unfair and there is no logical explanation behind it.

attributes.action: Ban Fines for Parking Ticket Mistakes
attributes.background:
Honest people who have purchased valid parking tickets are being fined because of genuine mistakes - such as accidentally mistyping number plates in car parks that use number plate recognition. 

The British Parking Association know this - but their appeal system but offers no help.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has nothing to do with fines for overstaying or not purchasing a ticket - this is for genuine mistakes.

Typically people have a single character wrong on their ticket - and still appeals side with the car park owners.

To anyone else - it would be clear that the driver had made a genuine mistake, and paid the correct amount for the time allocated.

This money making on genuine mistakes should be stopped.

A typing error should not cost someone Â£60+

attributes.action: Ban overseas investment in UK property
attributes.background: The UK / London has been experiencing large scale foreign investment in the UK residential housing market. Foreign investment is endemic causing overpriced properties to be built, sold or left empty etc.
attributes.additional_details: Research carried out by the BBC into investors from the Russian Federation, China, Hong Kong, Africa etc. shows buying property in the UK has reached epidemic proportions. Housing bought by non-UK residents could be used as a bank or to hide money (laundering). Wholesale, buying off plan of entire blocks of flats or buildings is causing the UK housing market to spiral out of control. The UK Government should adopt the New Zealand policy of banning non NZ residents from buying propriety.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'no-fly' list banning disruptive & dangerous passengers from flying.
attributes.background: Presently several politicians claim the lack of alcohol-licensing at airports is to blame for an increase in air rage incidents.  Therefore several are pushing to restrict in-flight alcohol-sales at airports and in-flight, which would punish the majority.
attributes.additional_details: Instead of punishing the majority of decent passengers, a 'no-fly' list, similar to the one the Americans have, would be fairer on the majority of passengers and more effective in preventing alcohol-related problems like air rage.  Also the prospect of being given a lengthy or indefinite ban from flying would likely provide a much greater disincentive to avoid breaking the law during flights.

attributes.action: Create a new public holiday for Indian new year's day
attributes.background: Show the British people that Government policies are truly representative of the the cultural diversity across our society. Diwali and Indian New Year mark an important time of the year for many different groups and we should mark this occasion with a public holiday.

attributes.action: Make spent conviction dismissals a protected right for -2 years in employment
attributes.background: Having recently been dismissed for having a spent conviction despite the protection under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1979. Under employment law this action is unlawful and would lead to an automatic unfair dismissal if an individual has 2 years service. This action is discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Sec 4 of the rehabilitation of offenders act 1979 makes it unlawful to be sacked simply for not disclosing a spent conviction, yet there is no penalty or recourse for the rehabilitated person to take action against this form of discrimination!  
As this is already listed as an automatic unfair dismissal, then it should be looked at to decrease the requirement of 2 years service and treat it the same as the other protected reasons such as whistleblowing, discrimination etc.

attributes.action: The Government should buy Leonardo da Vinci's "Salvatore Mundi" for the nation
attributes.background: Painted by Leonardo at his best, fully authenticated, a snip at Â£75 million.
attributes.additional_details: If the French have " Mona Lisa", why can't we have "Salvatore Mundi"?

attributes.action: Change Corporation tax so that only UK costs can be used to offset profits.
attributes.background: In the last week it has been reported that Ebay UK and AirBnB have both paid significantly less corporation tax than would seem fair, both have acted within the law that allows costs from abroad to be used against profits achieved in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: By only allowing costs incurred in the UK for UK tax purposes this would level the playing field, deter replacing of UK jobs with jobs in lower cost countries and improve tax revenues. This would also align with PAYE tax rules.

attributes.action: Introduce a cap on the cost of postgraduate degrees
attributes.background: Postgraduate fees are not governed by the same rules that undergraduate fees are. Student are regularly left with a short fall and having to money to help pay for courses or living costs. There is no consistency with postgraduate fees like there is with undergraduate fees.
attributes.additional_details: Postgraduate courses can vary from Â£6000 up to Â£25000, meaning that students may have to find and extra Â£15000 to pay for the course after and if they receive the full Â£10000 loan from the government, that doesnât include living costs! This is clearly putting a number of students at a disadvantage and preventing them from studying postgraduate courses as many will not able to find this amount of money. We should be encouraging education, therefore a cap on fees would be the best option.

attributes.action: Schools to have paediatric adrenaline auto-injectors for children in anaphylaxis
attributes.background: Schools have an increasing number of children with severe allergies. There have been at least 2 cases recently of a child dying from anaphylaxis at school. Each school having their own adrenaline auto injectors could contribute to saving a childâs life when they are having an anaphylactic event.
attributes.additional_details: Each school would need 2 paediatric auto injectors which would be kept in an area accessible and known to all staff. Staff would also check the product is in date.

attributes.action: Make it law for every alcohol transaction to require approved photo ID
attributes.background: Many shop assistants every day are physically or verbally abused for asking for proof of age when purchasing alcohol a simple change to the law requiring that approved ID must be shown for every transaction would help reduce attempted under age purchases and remove cashier errors in assessing age
attributes.additional_details:
A simple law that states no ID no sale on alcohol would remove the possibility of human error in judging people's ages and would help to Reduce verbal and physical confrontations if customers knew the law was no ID no sale.
Across the country workers have been subjected to abuse because of guessing a customers age who subsequently causes a scene in an attempt to intimidate the cashier into selling the product.
A No ID no sale law would be a simple fix so everyone knows where they stand.

attributes.action: Ban the use of domestic Wood Burning Stoves to improve air quality for all
attributes.background: Wood burning stoves are becoming more and more common which is evidenced by the tangible and demonstrable drop in air quality in recent years. You do not need any scientific equipment to witness the drop in quality. Just step outside on any cold day or night and you will smell the foul acrid smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Breathing clean, unpolluted, fresh smelling air should be a basic human right, but yet in modern Britain it is not as people are permitted to set fire to wood in order to create heat, which is completely unnecessary in 2018. Household wood burners should be banned immediately before more people are duped into buying them under the green banner and releasing more harmful particulates into the air. It is a shame to think that breathing clean fresh crisp winter air is currently a thing of the past.

attributes.action: On four lane motorways, restrict HGV vehicles and coaches to lanes 1 and 2.
attributes.background: The country has spent billions in upgrading traditional motorways to four lane smart motorways, however all this investment is wasted as soon as you get three trucks trying to overtake each other at 55mph. Trucks should be limited to lanes 1 and 2 to allow faster travellers to go in lanes 3 and 4.

attributes.action: Review the current VED (Road tax) system and implement a pay per mile system.
attributes.background: The current road tax system uses a blanket rule type system to cover the taxation of all uk vehicles based solely on emissions. This system does not take into account how much time each of these vehicles is spent on the road causing wear and tear on the road network.
attributes.additional_details:
A review and overhaul of the tax system is required to bring a  fairer balance to road users. 

E.g - a pensioner who makes one trip a week in his car.  Should not pay the same amount in road tax as someone who uses their car for commuting to work everyday.

The current system does not reflect road use/wear and tear on the network. This could be easily be rectified by directly linking the VED (Road tax) to the fuel at the pump. 

The more fuel you use in your car the more tax you pay.

attributes.action: Ban unconditional offers for entrance to university
attributes.background: Universities have embarked on a race to the bottom in admissions standards in a now liberalised marketplace. To benefit society, the free market needs a framework of rules within which to operate. The government should legislate to prohibit this harmful practice, which is damaging pupil attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
The number of unconditional offers for entrance to university made to 18 year olds in England, Wales and N.I. is exploding:

2013      3,000
2014    12,100
2015    23,400
2016    36,800
2017    51,600

UCAS recorded one in six applicants receiving one or more unconditional offers in 2017.

Such offers remove the incentive for pupils to work, leading to lower attainment at A Level, as UCAS' own research has demonstrated: see pages 18-9 of https://www.ucas.com/file/71796/download?token=D4uuSzur.

attributes.action: Cancel South Western Railwayâs contract & to investigate their mismanagement.
attributes.background:
South Western Railway was awarded the South Western franchise in March 2017, & took over from South West Trains on the 20th August. SWT had managed the franchise for nearly 20 years.

Since the takeover, the number of delays have increased, delays have got longer, & cancellations have increased.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should investigate why the franchise has significantly worsensed since it changed hands, & why it changed during the Waterloo upgrade. Why is the service worse after the upgrade?

Need to compare the % of delayed trains now with the amount of delayed trains SWTâs had. Also stats for the length of delays, as well as the % of cancelled trains. Not just overal stats either, peak times/rush hour stats need to be anyalsed.

The government needs to consider cancelling SWRâs contract.

attributes.action: Relegalise the possession of fresh (unprepared) psilocybin ('magic') mushrooms.
attributes.background:
Psilocybin mushrooms have thousands of years of recorded human use. Studies indicate that they help sufferers of mental illness, depression, anxiety and many other medical conditions.

They are also used in many spiritual and religious practices and remain legal around the world.
attributes.additional_details:
Psilocybin mushrooms are non-toxic, are not addictive and have not been shown to have any detrimental effect on long-term mental health they grow naturally within the UK and continue to be sold legally in the Netherlands with no adverse consequences.

They have significant potential as medicines, with psilocybin being investigated as a treatment for depression, anxiety, addiction and PTSD. Research shows that just a single dose of psilocybin lifts anxiety and depression for six months or longer.

attributes.action: Create a âResidential Care Voucherâ scheme
attributes.background: As a parent to a young child, I can take advantage of the tax-efficient way to pay towards her childcare. I propose a similar scheme be set up so that people can save towards the often unmanageable costs surrounding residential care for elderly loved ones.
attributes.additional_details:
A scheme should exist where:
Employees can pay into a âpotâ that is dedicated to the residential / end-of-life care of loved ones.
Monies saved are protected by a government-backed scheme (similar to savings at the bank)
Savings to the employee are present through salary-sacrifice
Monies deposited  are available should they become not necessary
People can chose to pay into their own account and/or an account for a relative/friend 

The scheme should mirror the current childcare voucher scheme

attributes.action: Create a January re-sit opportunity for all GCSE English and maths re-sits.
attributes.background: More students than ever in FE colleges are finding themselves back in contexts associated with failure. For many, the November re-sit is too early. January, on the other hand, would allow sufficient time for effective preparation and for teachers to assess who is and isn't ready.

attributes.action: Teach LGBTQ sexual education in schools and about other sexuality's.
attributes.background: Within schools teaching LGBTQ sexual education is not on the curriculum, leaving those who are homosexual without the correct education that they need to have healthy and positive sexual experiences, with many contracting diseases. The spectrum of sexuality's are also left open for stereotyping.
attributes.additional_details:
The GLSEN 2013 National School Climate Survey found that fewer than five percent of LGBT students had health classes that included positive representations of LGBTQ topics.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-33237995-for facts on sexually transmitted diseases for men

https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/a-to-z/s/sexuality-for how mental health affects those on the spectrum.

attributes.action: Provide victims of the most severe sexual crimes anonymity throughout trial.
attributes.background: Currently victims of crimes under the Sexual Offences (Amendment) Act 1992 are given lifetime anonymity from the media. Despite attempts to fully provide protection during trial details of the victims name are made available to the accused; even in cases of serious sexual assault by a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls for other means of identifying victims such as pseudonym, case number or photo to be considered.
 
Sexual assaults are crimes of power and control, a name is a key part of personal identity so giving the accused the victimâs name adds to the assault. Much of what you do or are is linked to your name, having it makes it easy to identify, locate or contact someone.
 
Using a victimâs name within courts would seem to contravene Article 8 of the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: Create NHS teams for the atypical patients & Stop them falling through the gaps!
attributes.background: I have spent my life living with complex illnesses, and this coupled with also having a rare illness, I have found myself falling through the gaps in the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Because my situation and symptoms are âatypicalâ  I have spent the last few years being passed around in the system to different departments and teams, but never being taken on by their services as I do not meet the criteria or âfit in their boxâ. This has been made worse by the funding crisis, as no one is prepared to take on the atypical cases.

I propose the creation of specialist multi-disciplinary teams to take on the atypical cases, so that no one also falls through the gaps in the system.

attributes.action: Relocate UK parliament and government departments somewhere outside London.
attributes.background:
The Palace of Westminster is in poor condition, requiring Â£4B of refurbishment work, at state expense. It's, also, regularly argued that government is too London-centric.
It's time to relocate government to a new common site, outside London, and use Westminster Palace as a commercial asset.
attributes.additional_details:
Today, Westminster Palace is a far from suitable place from where to run government and, overall, London is over-crowded, costly and detached from much of the country. Considering these points, I propose constructing a modern government campus, in a more central location, with good London transport links, perhaps, somewhere around where the M1 and west-coast main lines converge, in Northamptonshire.
The campus should include a station and accommodation for MPs staying away from home.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists from the road and allow them on the pavement
attributes.background: Cyclists should be banned from the road, as they can be dangerous to drivers on the road and they are slow and they block your path. They sometimes donât follow the rules of the road when there is traffic and they go onto pavement. Hence why they should be legally allowed to stick to the pavement.

attributes.action: Every person in the UK to be given a tree to plant to reverse UK deforestation
attributes.background: The UK is believed to be in deforestation (cut down more trees than are planted). This is on top of the UK tree land mass (13%) is far behind other countries, EU (38%), Japan (68%), USA (34%). If every person in the UK were given a tree to plant the UK tree population could dramatically increase

attributes.action: Reduce VAT rate on fixed telephone lines and broadband
attributes.background:
Telephone lines with broadband are an essential utility for the 21st century.

Currently there is a 20% VAT levied on all services, other essential utilities are not subject to such a high rate of taxation.
attributes.additional_details:
The government is well aware of the benefits of a connected society and documents them extensively: https://www.gov.uk/government/policies/broadband-investment

Individuals and businesses benefit massively from internet and telephone connectivity and this in turn benefits our economy.

Other utilities which are essential, such as water, electricity and gas are subject to reduced rates of taxation. Telephone and broadband services should be treated the same, as an essential utility.

attributes.action: Call for all people who mentally cause suicide to be prosecuted for MURDER
attributes.background:
This petition calls for 'murder' to be redefined so that if it can be proven that one person has committed suicide as a result of another person's/ other people's actions, a murder charge can result.
The punishment will be a starting point of a minimum of 15 years in prison (12 years for under 18s)
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are killing themselves due to other people's evil actions. There is currently no crime that has been committed.
Manslaughter is 'the crime of killing a human being without malice aforethought'. That basically means that if you physically kill somebody without intent or the mental capacity to understand your actions.
To force a person to suicide, a person must have such great intent to harm others. There is malice! Murder could be 'killing a human deliberately or due to bullying'

attributes.action: Provide better mental health services for 17 year olds
attributes.background: At the age of 17 it's one of the most stressful periods of your life and yet there is no support out there for those who have mental health difficulties unless you're already in the system
attributes.additional_details: CAMHS is for children and adolescents; IAPT is for 18 and over year olds. At 17, CAMHS say that you're too old to be in their care and IAPT says you're too young! So there needs to be a better system which provides for 17 year olds in the transition period to being an adult.

attributes.action:
Award H/B so rents paid in full to parents/sons/daughters over 18
M/Severe ASD
attributes.background: No discrimination in H/Benefit.Rent for parents with children over 18 who have moderate to severe Autism Spectrum disorder should be paid in full as thousands of parents cannot work and are stuck on benefits due to lack of support as their young adult doesn't have the capacity to live independently.
attributes.additional_details:
My son is now 20 years old and does not have full coherency. I have singular guardianship. He receives very little support and I receive the same 10 hrs. At the last meeting social services wanted to 
drop those hours by a further 4. I cannot work because I am my sons 
full time carer, meaning I am forced to remain on benefits. I have rent & bills to pay not to mention ensuring that their are hearty meals on the table for a growing lad. My housing benefit doesn't cut it do S/Fall's still Â£374 pm

attributes.action: Formally support UN condemnation of the Saudi bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera.
attributes.background: A UN High Commissioner has condemned the Saudi-led bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera as an "unacceptable attack on the right to freedom of expression and opinion". The government should explicitly support the UN and oppose the Salman regime's attempt to censor TV channels available in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UN High Commissioner is Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein:
http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/06/high-commissioner-zeid-raad-al-hussein-call-shut-al-jazeera-unacceptable-attack-170630111642647.html

It is unacceptable to tolerate Saudi interference in what British audiences should be permitted to watch. The government should issue a formal declaration of support for the UN and unequivocally repudiate such Saudi meddling in our sources of news. It is not for the Saudis to censor our television channels.

attributes.action: Raise the motorway speed limit to 80mph for electric cars
attributes.background:
Almost all over Europe the speed limits are higher than in the UK.
We should raise the speed limit in the UK as well.
If all cars could go faster that would raise the pollution, so raise the speed limit only for greener and usually safer electric cars

attributes.action: Fund Sound Therapy For People With Tourette Syndrome
attributes.background: My name is Jason, im a 20 year old male who suffers from Tourette Syndrome, i have suffered this for many years now and can NOT get the funding to join a sound therapy course
attributes.additional_details: i believe sound therapy would be extremely influential into helping solve the ongoing problem "how do i handle my tics" or "how do i cure my tourettes?" the simple answer is, there is NO cure for Tourette Syndrome, however after research, and being a musician myself, music and drama both seem to reduce the amount i tic, i also underwent a short taster of sound therapy and it reduced my tics sufficiently, i want to help people without tourette understand and people with, to manage it.

attributes.action: The UK must expel the North Korean ambassador
attributes.background:
North Korea is a rogue state threatening the entire world.  They are extreme cybercriminals, exporters of terrorism, and have now ramped up their nuclear weapons programme in defiance of UN sanctions and international outcry.

We must send a strong message by expelling their ambassador.
attributes.additional_details:
Other countries which have expelled their North Korean ambassador include: Spain; Kuwait; Peru; Mexico; and Botswana.  Meanwhile Egypt, the Philippines, and Uganda have drastically scaled back diplomatic ties.

London has an (est. 20,000) Korean community from both North and South.  North Korean "enforcers" spy on this community as well as locals (who aren't always Korean) near the embassy, intimidating people who joke about the country or regime.

They shouldn't benefit from life in London.

attributes.action: Use the money needed to change the passport colour for the NHS and the homeless
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has just announced that after Brexit our passports will change colour. This seems completely unnecessary and the money and resources needed could be put to better use like helping our underfunded NHS and helping homeless people off the streets.

attributes.action: Keep accepting credit card payments for all tax payments
attributes.background: The Government are stopping accepting credit card payments from 13th January 2018 - please sign to keep the acceptance of credit card payments after this date.
attributes.additional_details: Small business owner

attributes.action: Ban all stand alone ATMâs
attributes.background: Everyday the news and social media are reporting on the increasing crime of Ram Raids on shops for the stand alone cash machines (ATM). Some of these shops have been targeted more than once. This has to stop, and the only way we can help, is to have the stand alone machines removed from shops now.
attributes.additional_details: The Police can only advise shopkeepers on security and not enforce it, and the stand alone ATMâs do not have trackers fitted or âSmartâ Water. I am asking for these cash machines to be removed from shops, and the initial temptation for these criminals will also be removed. Livelihoods, jobs, are all disrupted. Bank / Post office branch cash machines are better installed and are rarely raided, we live in a world where we pay for things via apps, so cash is not that essential.
